availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Coleman (Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Duncan Coleman in Oldham County, Kentucky, on February 20, 1837. Father of William Oscar Coleman, Mary Coleman, and Martha J. Coleman. Farmer in Trimble County in 1850. Farmer in Trimble County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, District No. 1, p. 407B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 28. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 4. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910), Madison County Courthouse, Oldham County Marriages (Accessed via ancestry). Find A Grave, "William Lawson Coleman (1816-1896)," Memorial #22626622, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22626622/william-lawson-coleman (accessed March 26, 2018).
